main_definition: To reach a decision or judgement after considering all relevant information, or to bring something to an end.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Reach a final judgment or decision about something based on evidence or reasoning
meanings_and_examples.example: After examining the data and listening to both sides of the argument, I can conclude that we should proceed with the project.

meanings_and_examples.definition: End an event, discussion, or activity after it has been completed
meanings_and_examples.example: At the end of the meeting, they concluded the agenda items and agreed on a follow-up plan.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Make a final decision in legal proceedings
meanings_and_examples.example: The judge will conclude the case with his verdict after hearing all testimonies and evidence.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Conclude something by drawing inferences or logical conclusions from facts or observations
meanings_and_examples.example: From her behavior, I can conclude that she is not feeling well today.

meanings_and_examples.definition: End a written work (such as an essay or article) with summarizing remarks or final thoughts
meanings_and_examples.example: In the conclusion of his research paper, the author reiterated the importance of further studies in the field.
